entry.title: The Aftermath (Baby, It's All A Bad Dream, I Promise)
entry.summary:
Author: paperless_paperweight

Rating: ExplicitLanguage: EnglishWords: 2,863Chapters: 1/5Kudos: 0

Summary: After tragedy strikes the 118, Eddie returns home and he and Buck are forced to navigate their grief. Eddie’s trying to rebuild a life that no longer fits the same, while Buck’s retreating into silence and memories. Somewhere between sorrow and second chances, they might find their way back to each other—if they can face the truths they've both been running from.Grief is never clean. Healing is never simple. And sometimes, home is a person.

entry.title: I'll be along when I finish my song
entry.summary:
Author: Petr1chor

Rating: Not RatedLanguage: EnglishWords: 3,147Chapters: 1/1Kudos: 0

Summary: This is Bobby Nash. I can’t come to the phone right now, leave a message after the beep.Buck gasped at his voice, even though he dialed the number to hear it. “Hi, Bobby. I made your chilli for the wake. Everyone loved it. Jee even asked for seconds,” he laughed.He paused for a minute. “They cleaned you up real good, Cap. No blood. Black suit though, not the blue one. Your mom brought it, said it was your dads.” Buck pressed his eyes shut. “I was strong for everyone, Bobby. I did good. I didn’t cry,” his voice broke, “I- I don’t know what to say. I- I miss you.” xxx Grief is easier when shared, and Buck relies on his support system

entry.title: Those he left behind
entry.summary:
Author: DaniWib

Rating: MatureLanguage: EnglishWords: 14,073Chapters: 3/5Kudos: 313

Summary: All Buck wanted was to be with his family, but things weren’t the same after the lawsuit. He was sidelined, buried in chores, still on the outs with the 118, especially Bobby and Eddie. Unwilling to give up on them, Buck kept his head down and did his job.Until he died, all alone, while his team was out on a call.Grief and guilt consume them. They should have been there, should have seen the signs— should have saved him. But Bobby had let his anger blind him, believing there’d be time to make things right. And Eddie had stayed silent, convinced there’d be a someday. Now, Buck is gone, and they can never make it right.They weren’t the only ones Buck left behind, however. When a group of Navy SEALs arrives at Buck’s funeral, their presence brings more than just surprise. It brings truths the 118 never saw coming, and more grief than they ever could have imagined.[Fic is complete and will be updated weekly on Sunday nights, AEST]

entry.title: Sweet Like Honey
entry.summary:
Author: ItsBuckleyTime

Rating: Not RatedLanguage: EnglishWords: 24,159Chapters: 22/?Kudos: 32

Summary: Eddie is a cynical, sharp-tongued beekeeper who’s perfectly happy living alone with his bees and his books on a quiet mountainside. People annoy him. Especially tourists. Especially loud, cheerful ones who park their camper van too close to his driveway.So when Buck—an endlessly sunny, chatty travel vlogger—rolls into town with a bright yellow van and an even brighter smile, Eddie’ peaceful life is over. Or at least, severely disrupted.

entry.title: You don't find it, you make it!
entry.summary:
Author: Phoenix_parklife

Rating: ExplicitLanguage: EnglishWords: 600,650Chapters: 113/118Kudos: 896

Summary: After a troubling childhood growing up in London, England, 25-year-old Evan Buckley decided to move to LA and try and find his place in the world. Applying to become a firefighter, he enrolls in the LAFD fire academy before being assigned to station 118. As he works on building friendships with his co-workers, he also tries to find the family he’s always wanted and find the love of his life.As his secrets are discovered, and people from his past come back into his life, will he be able to find his family, or will he learn that family isn’t found… it’s made.

entry.title: You Touched Down in the Base of My Fears
entry.summary:
Author: fruitsdoesnotknow

Rating: Teen And Up AudiencesLanguage: EnglishWords: 10,158Chapters: 1/1Kudos: 73

Summary: “Do not make this more difficult for us. If Buck ends up pouting for the next hour because he thinks you’re not having fun, I’m murdering you,” Hen threatens. “Bobby vetoed murder after Ravi and Buck got into that fight about sparrows,” Chimney interjects. “No, I’m bringing it back.” “Understood,” Chimney nods, and Eddie suppresses rolling his eyes at them, but only because he gets distracted when Buck turns to him, bright-eyed and bushy-tailed, clipboard in hand with a pen in the other. “Eddie! I accidentally started filling in your form. Here, you can have this one,” Buck passes it over and Eddie scans it, seeing how Buck wrote all his details perfectly. They share an address now, and Eddie grins down at the line, 4995 South Bedford Street, the place where their lives overlap and cross over and mesh as one. Where they share a bed and wake up tangled and laugh about it, and Eddie wants to cross that line, wants so much, wants to shake Buck and yell how he feels and he doesn’t know how much longer he’ll be able to keep it all in. ***Or, the 118 attempt an escape room. Buck and Eddie attempt to be normal for sixty minutes.

entry.title: Goodbye to Always (I love you so)
entry.summary:
Author: Carbon_Gravity

Rating: Not RatedLanguage: EnglishWords: 732Chapters: 1/?Kudos: 0

Summary: Buck took out his phone to order himself an Uber and found Eddie’s address sitting in the destination spot by default. Buck looked at it and laughed a little. It was fitting, like the universe telling him this was the right thing to do.He looked up at the sky and while he couldn’t see the stars, he knew they were blinking at him. Encouraging him to take the Uber to Eddie and confess everything he had inside him in the morning. Buck didn’t know what the future had in store for them but Buck knew deep down that if he didn’t tell Eddie before he left Califo—A freezing sensation washed over Buck until he felt like his heart pumping blood through his veins was the only heat Buck had ever known.Eddie was leaving California.Eddie was leaving California.Eddie was leaving.Buck stood frozen in place for who knows how long while his thoughts spiraled.——
